TR.TD:
required
value/format:string
class: all
The unique ID string used for the collection. Usually corresponds to the directory name holding the collection files.

required
value/format:string
class: all
The collection name as it will appear on the cross-collection results lists, in the collection picker (sorted alphabetically), and on the home page for the collection.

optional
value/format:string
class: all
For constructing the contact mailto link; contains the content of the HREF attribute of the A element (e.g., "mailto:hti-info@umich.edu/")

optional
value/format:string
class: all
For constructing the contact mailto link; contains the content of the A element that will appear as the link text (e.g. "hti-info@umich.edu/").

optional
value/format:string
class: all
For constructing the organization mailto link; contains the content of the HREF attribute of the A element (e.g., "mailtoorginfo@umich.edu/")

optional
value/format:string
class: all
For constructing the organization mailto link; contains the content of the A element that will appear as the link text (e.g. "org-info@umich.edu/").

required
value/format:string
class: text, bib
The URL for the host webserver hosting the middleware. (e.g. "http//www.hti.umich.edu/")

required
value/format:string
class: all
The host name for the machine hosting the collection data and data indexes. This is usually the same host hosting the middleware.
The value should agree with the value of the HTTP_HOST environment variable set by a webserver running on that machine. (e.g., "www.hti.umich.edu/")

required
value/format: array
class: all
bib, image: A list of one or more XPAT .dd files for the collection. Their location is specified by the dddir field.
text: A list of one or more XPAT dd files for the collection specified as full paths relative to DLXSROOT..

required
value/format: string
class: bib, image
The directory containing the XPAT dd file or files (specified in the dd field) for the collection.

optional
value/format:string
class: all
The name of a single machine you don't want this collection to appear on, if you are running the middleware on multiple servers.

optional
value/format:string
class: text
POSIX standard locale values, used for sorting of words with 8-bit characters.
If not supplied, the locale for sorting defaults to the locale of the webserver running the middleware. If a collection is predominantly French, the locale value would be 'fr'. For more information about locales, type "locale -a" at the prompt of any Unix machine.

required
value/format:string
class: all
The location of the TerminologyMapper map file for the collection.

required
value/format:string
class: text, bib
The directory where text/image objects are stored. Only necessary for collections.

optional
value/format:number
class: all
The access port for the XPAT daemon on the machine identified in "host" above. Only necessary for collections where data and indexes are on a different machine than the middleware (CGI program).

optional
value/format:string
class: all
The field takes "yes" or "no" as a value. If "yes" the navbar browse link will appear and if clicked, browse.tpl will be served from the collection-specific web dir.

required
value/format:string
class: all
The directory path relative to DLXSROOT for the collection (usually in the form /c/collid).

optional
value/format:string
class: text
The location of the XPAT data dictionary for the collection word wheel/word index, if there is one.

required
value/format:string
class: bib
If a value other than default is supplied for the extendedname, the value will appear on individual search pages (e.g., simple or advanced) above the search input boxes.

required
value/format:number
class: bib
The maximum valid year value to be used to check user input for date searches.

optional
value/format:number
class: bib
The year increment value to be used for date searches.

required
value/format:number
class: bib
The minimum valid year value to be used to check user input for date searches.

optional
value/format:string
class: bib
The primarytitle can be presented as a link. If a value other than default appears in the database, the template renders that value as a link. (See primarytitle)

required
value/format:value/format: string
class: bib
The first title (or graphical banner) that appears at the top of the initial web page. Text strings must be preceded by "text:" and graphical banners must be preceded by "graphic:". The template and database permit either a textual title or a graphical banner, but not both. (See primaryhref)

required
value/format:string
class: bib
A textual second title, appearing below the primarytitle. If the value default appears, no secondary title is displayed.

required
value/format:string
class: image
Often the same as collname, but used in the header of pages. May be specified as text, or as a graphic (e.g., image:bhlbanner.gif). Graphic file must be in $DLXSROOT/web/[c/collid]/graphics. The banner for cross collection display is configured in imageclass.cfg (in cgi dir).

required
value/format:string
class: image
A brief version of the collection name. Used for display beneath thumbnail images in results view.

required
value/format:string
class: image
Used to configure the "browse images" link on collection specific index pages. Enter "default" to retrieve all records with images. Leave the field blank to omit the link completely. Enter any search term (e.g., "snow") to retrieve sample records that match the term.

required
value/format:string
class: image
Used to configure the "browse records" link on collection specific index pages. Enter "default" to retrieve all records (with or without images). Leave the field blank to omit the link completely. Enter any search term (e.g., "snow") to retrieve sample records that match the term.

required
value/format:default or array
class: image
The list of fields (as abbreviations) to display in entry (full record) views. To display all fields, enter the value "default".
For details about the full range of options, please see the appropriate Image Class documentation.

required
value/format:default or array
class: image
The list of fields (as abbreviations) to display in the results view that includes the full record (i.e., thumbfull view). To display all fields, enter the value "default".
For details about the full range of options, please see the appropriate Image Class documentation.

required
value/format:default or array
class: image
The list of fields (as abbreviations) that may be searched. These are the fields that show up in the search form. to display all fields, enter the value "default".

required
value/format:array
class: image
The entry/record display uses HTML DIVs to provide two different display modes (i.e., "full image" and "description"). The user can flip back and forth between the two display modes. If a collection has records with images and descriptions, you will want to include both, (e.g., full image, on one line, and description, on another ). For a collection that has descriptions but no images, you probably want to only include "description."

required
value/format:string
class: image
The default display mode for the entry/record display. When the record is first displayed, should the "full image" view be shown first, or the "description" view?

required
value/format: string
class: image
The default size for image display. There are several ways to specify the quality. examples:
h600 -- height no larger than 600 pixels
w500 -- width no larger than 600 pixels
m800 -- max dimension of image no larger than 800 pixels
min -- smallest available
max -- largest available
mid -- mid-size among available
preview -- defined in imageclass.cfg ($gDefaultPreviewImageSize)
screen -- defined in imageclass.cfg ($gDefaultScreenImageSize)
integer value -- MrSID res value

optional
value/format:string
class: image
Allows a restriction to be put on the maximum full size image displayed. Definable in terms similar to imgqual above.leave field blank for no restriction.

optional
value/format:string
class: image
Allows a restriction to be put on the minimum full size image displayed. Definable in terms similar to imgqual above.leave field blank for no restriction.

required
value/format:string
class: image
Controls the presence and default status of the "media only" restriction in the search form. There are several possible values.

required
value/format:number
class: image
The number of text fields to display in search form.

required
value/format:string
class: image
Related view menu. Set to "on" to display a pop-up menu in the entry/record view that allows navigation to any of the images associated with the entry/record (the record must have multiple images). Useful as a page-flipping mechanism. e.g.: "off".

required
value/format:string
class: image
String of instruction text to precede the related view menu (relviewmenu). e.g.: "default".

required
value/format:string
class: image
String of text to precede each item in the related view menu (relviewmenu) e.g.: "default."

required
value/format:string
class: image
The SGML ISTRUCT attribute to use for display values in the related view menu (relviewmenu)
e.g.: "default" (same as "CAPTIONS").
In addition to "CAPTIONS", any of the ISTRUCT attribute names are valid (e.g., "FACE").

required
value/format:number
class: image
Maximum character string length for each field in dfltresflds. This is used for trimming long fields down to the specified number of characters when being displayed under thumbnail images. e.g.: "50".

required
value/format:default or array
class: image
The list of fields (as abbreviations) to display in "captions only " results view. To display all fields, enter the value "default".

required
value/format:array
class: image
The list of results views to be made available to users. Legal values are any combination of: thumbnail, thumbfull, reslist. Order is not important.

required
value/format:string
class: image
The default result view. Legal values (choose one): thumbnail, thumbfull, reslist

required
value/format:array
class: image
The list of field abbreviations that should be provided as options for sorting. Sort fields for multiple collections is configured in the groups database. "none" must always be the first value.

required
value/format:default or array
class: image
The list of fields (as abbreviations) To display in "thumbnail with full record" results view. to display all fields, enter the value "default".

required
value/format:default or array
class: image
The list of fields (as abbreviations) to display in "thumbnail with captions" results view. To display all fields, enter the value "default".

required
value/format:array
class: text
The regions in which citation searches are conducted (minimally, citation).

optional
value/format:
class: text
Supply one or more of 'isogreek', 'pldgreek', 'chgreek', 'ipa', or 'misc' to filter each class of character entity references (if present in the collection data).

required
value/format:
class: text
A number indicating the deepest level of encoding present in the collection, e.g. "4" if the lowest division is <DIV4>

optional
value/format:string
class: text
Indicates whether there are maps for dates of first publication, if available, in the form YYYY where YYYY is the earliest publication date. Derived from markup in the collection. Must be supported by entries in the collection map.

optional
value/format:string
class: text
Indicates whether there are maps for dates of first publication, if available, in the form YYYY where YYYY is the latest publication date. Must be supported by entries in the collection map.

optional
value/format:string
class: text
Indicates whether there are maps for dates of first publication, if available, X where X is increment in the number of years between firstpublishedstart and firstpublishedend. Derived from markup in the collection. Must be supported by entries in the collection map.

reserved for future use
value/format:
class: text
Not currently used.

required
value/format:array
class: text
Standard terms assigned to describe the contents of a collection, used by the collection picker. Derived from collection coordinator's assessment of the collection. Available values are specified in $DLXSROOT/cgi/t/text/textclass.cfg.

required
value/format:array
class: text
Gender of the principal authors of the works in this collection, used by the collection picker. Derived from collection coordinator's assessment of the collection. Available values are specified in $DLXSROOT/cgi/t/text/textclass.cfg. One of 'male', female', 'all'.

required
value/format:array
class: text
The languages of texts in collections, used by the collection picker. Available values are specified in $DLXSROOT/cgi/t/text/textclass.cfg. Derived from collection coordinator's assessment of the collection.

required
value/format:number
class: text
The encoding level of the document that has the lowest level of encoding of any document in the collection.

optional
value/format:string
class: text
Used to specify the proper link target div form a level 2 collection results list. The existence of any value in the field will make a level 2 collection have a results string where teh "item of interest" is the string that is the value of the field. important:The value of the string must correspond to a fabricated region of the same name.

required
value/format:
class: text
A list of the most deeply nested elements in the collection's SGML/XML, (e.g. "LINE"), which, in boolean and proximity searches are listed as search regions in the search form pulldown. For each low-level search region in the pulldown, use the corresponding value marked up by the <SYNTHETIC> element in the collection's map file for that region. Used to generate the region hit summary in boolean and proximity results displays, e.g. "7 lines" within a given scene within a given act in a given play.

optional
value/format:
class: text
If collection contains notes, this is the number of the most deeply nested division enclosing either a <NOTE> or the target of a <PTR>, e.g. "3" if <DIV3> is the lowest division containing <NOTE> or the target of a <PTR>.

optional
value/format:
class: text
Supply either or both of 'inline' or 'ptr' to filter each kind of note (if present in the collection data) corresponding to <NOTE> and <PTR> elements.

required
value/format:array
class: text
The date ranges covered by collections, used by the collection picker. Available values are specified in $DLXSROOT/cgi/t/text/textclass.cfg. Derived from collection coordinator's assessment of the collection.

required
value/format:number
class: text
The number of DLPSTEXTCLASS objects (or texts) in the collection.

optional
value/format:string
class: text
The location of rank files. Only necessary for collections with more than one data dictionary.

required
value/format:array
class: text, bib
The regions which are retrieved for Boolean searches (minimally, "work").

optional
value/format:string
class: text
'mappped' indicates that there are maps for specific assigned genders for a single collection, used to create restrictions for searches if available. Otherwise blank. Derived from markup in the collection. Must be supported by entries in the collection map.

optional
value/format:string
class: text
'mapped' indicates that there are maps for specific assigned genres for a single collection, used to create restrictions for searches if available. Otherwise blank. Derived from markup in the collection. Must be supported by entries in the collection map.

optional
value/format:string
class: text
'mapped' indicates that there are maps for specific assigned periods for a single collection, used to create restrictions for searches, if available. Otherwise blank. Derived from markup in the collection. Must be supported by entries in the collection map.

required
value/format:
class: text
Threshold above which results obtained from multiple indexes are not sorted.(e.g. "1000")

required
value/format:string, preceded by text: or graphic:
class: text
The collection banner for the standalone collection, which will create a link to the collections index page from all underlying pages.

reserved for future use
value/format:
class: text
Not currently used

required
value/format:string
class: bib, text
The name of the subclass module (without the '.pm' suffix) that defines the subclass of the TextClass or BibClass object for the collection.
Many text collections will simply use the value "TextClass" and, likewise, many bib collections will use the value "BibClass." For others with a specific subclass, the convention is "collidTC" ("collidBC" for bib) corresponding to the file collidTC.pm or collidBC.pm. These modules are located in the Text Class cgi directory for Text or Bib Class. (e.g., The subclass should be entered as "TextClass/collidTC").

required
value/format:string
class: all
The module name (without .pm suffix) of the Application Object or subclass thereof supporting the basic application functionality for a given class (Text, Image, Bib) of the middleware. Supply one of TextApp, ImageApp or BibApp for the default application behavior or a subclass if one has been written for this collection. (e.g., the subclass should be entered as "TextApp/FootCApp".)

required
value/format:string
class: text
The module name (without .pm suffix) of the PVApp object or subclass thereof supporting the pageviewer application for this collection. Use "PVApp" unless a subclass has been written for this collection. (e.g., the subclass should be entered as "PVApp/FooPCApp".)

required
value/format:
class: text
The module name (without .pm suffix) of the TextClassUtils object or subclass thereof supporting this collection. Use "TextClassUtils" unless a subclass has been written for this collection. (e.g., the subclass should be entered as "TextClassUtils/FooTCU".)

required
value/format:array
class: text
The regions in which simple searches are conducted, as they appear in the simple search pull-down menu (minimally, full text).

required
value/format:
class: text
The module name (without .pm suffix) of the WWApp object or subclass thereof supporting the wordwheel application for this collection. Use "WWApp" unless a subclass has been written for this collection. (e.g., subclass should be entered as "WWApp/FooWWApp".)

required
value/format:
class: text
The module name (without .pm suffix) of the PageView object or subclass thereof supporting the database access and image transformation function for the page viewer application for this collection. Use "PageView" unless a subclass has been written for this collection.(e.g., subclass should be entered as "PageView/FooPV".)

required
value/format:array (TITLE, AUTHOR, TEXT)
class: text
The SGML regions from which word wheel/word index words are gathered if a word wheel/word index is built.

required
value/format:array. (title, author, full text)
class: text
The values that appear (i.e., the displayed labels) with radio buttons on the word wheel/word index search template. Must correspond to wwrealms.

optional
value/format:string
class: text
Enter 1 if the collection has page images for viewing under page viewer, 0 otherwise.

optional
value/format:string.
class: text
If the collection has page images, enter one of 'image, 'text' or 'pdf' to control which view of the page the page viewer will offer by default.

optional
value/format:array
class: text
If the collection has page images, enter one or more of 'image, 'text' or 'pdf' to control which viewing formats will be displayed in the page viewer pulldown list.

optional
value/format:string.
class: text
If the collection has pdf, enter the number of image files which are to be bundled into a single pdf file for viewing under page viewer.

optional
value/format:string.
class: text
The format of the object which should be generated from the stored object, e.g. 'gif', 'pdf', 'tif'.

optional
value/format:string.
class: text
The format of the the stored object representing a page, e.g. 'gif', 'pdf', 'tif'. This is the source of the transformation whose output is specified by the pageviewimageformat field.

reserved for future use
value/format:string.
class: text
Placeholder for future enhancements. Not currently used.

reserved for future use
value/format:string.
class: text
Placeholder for future enhancements. Not currently used.
